nodes.bodyText:
Shouldn't we check HARD_GOALS_CONFIG and SELF_HEALING_GOALS_CONFIG are subset of GOALS_CONFIG instead of DEFAULT_GOALS_CONFIG here?
I though DEFAULT_GOALS_CONFIG is only used when there user run operation without provide goal list, GOALS_CONFIG is a set of all supported inter-broker goals.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -106,19 +107,21 @@ /** * Sanity check for *
    - *
  • {@link AnalyzerConfig#GOALS_CONFIG} and {@link AnalyzerConfig#INTRA_BROKER_GOALS_CONFIG} are non-empty.
    • + *
  • {@link AnalyzerConfig#GOALS_CONFIG} and {@link AnalyzerConfig#INTRA_BROKER_GOALS_CONFIG} are non-empty and disjoint.
    • *
  • Case insensitive goal names.
    • *
  • {@link AnalyzerConfig#DEFAULT_GOALS_CONFIG} is non-empty.
    • - *
  • {@link AnomalyDetectorConfig#SELF_HEALING_GOALS_CONFIG} is a sublist of {@link AnalyzerConfig#GOALS_CONFIG}.
    • + *
  • {@link AnalyzerConfig#DEFAULT_GOALS_CONFIG} is a subset of {@link AnalyzerConfig#GOALS_CONFIG}.
    • + *
  • {@link AnalyzerConfig#HARD_GOALS_CONFIG} is a subset of {@link AnalyzerConfig#DEFAULT_GOALS_CONFIG}.

nodes.bodyText:
HARD_GOALS_CONFIG is a subset of DEFAULT_GOALS_CONFIG to ensure that
hard goal violation checks are not skipped implicitly when a user calls the rebalance endpoint with no arguments -- i.e. please see the relevant sanity check.
SELF_HEALING_GOALS_CONFIG is a subset of DEFAULT_GOALS_CONFIG to minimize the conflicts between proposals generated via manually triggered default rebalance action and self-healing.

    • + *

    • *
  • Case insensitive goal names.
    • *

    • - *
  • {@link AnomalyDetectorConfig#SELF_HEALING_GOALS_CONFIG} is a sublist of {@link AnalyzerConfig#GOALS_CONFIG}.
    • + *
  • {@link AnalyzerConfig#DEFAULT_GOALS_CONFIG} is a subset of {@link AnalyzerConfig#GOALS_CONFIG}.
    • + *
  • {@link AnalyzerConfig#HARD_GOALS_CONFIG} is a subset of {@link AnalyzerConfig#DEFAULT_GOALS_CONFIG}.
